data.title: A Salt Lake icon for decades
data.text: Enjoyed Dees hamburgers as a kid.  Dees has gone from 1950's fast food drive-ins to quick food restaurants.  Food still good and plentiful. Service still good and reliable.  A welcome step up from McDonalds, Shari's, etc. yet not pricey like the pricey millennial places.  Dees are my go-to places in the Salt Lake area.

data.title: Let's go to Dee's, Let's all go to Dee's
data.text: Dee's Family Restaurant is one of those old type places with yummy comfort food. Breakfast all day and every other type of food too. Some great deserts.  There is something here for every one. I like the Lumberjack breakfast or the the Chicken Fried Steak.

data.title: Family Style at a Reasonable Price
data.text: This Dee's looked like it was straight out of the 60's, but the service was great and the food was REALLY good!  And you can get breakfast 24/7!  I will definitely go there again!

data.title: Best 'Chain' Breakfast
data.text: This is my favorite 'chain' 24 hour breakfast diner in Salt Lake.  They are a regional chain, but out shine all of the national chains.  They downsized a few years ago and closed a few locations.  The remaining locations do a good job with breakfast as their specialty.  There isn't one close to where I live, but I enjoy breakfast for dinner and when I get that craving the drive is worth it.   It has a retro diner feel and good family appeal.  The location I frequent has had the same staff for years and a lot of 'regulars'.  It's not the BEST breakfast in town, but if you like breakfast at odd times, this is a good choice.  They have a good selection of other 'diner' menu choices including pies, whole or by the slice.  My kids like their chicken fried steak, but I have never tried anything other than their breakfast selections.

data.title: Really gross experience.
data.text: The last time I was there it was summer. Their were flies around the table and the waitress brought a bowl of hot sauce to set on the table because she said it deterred the flies. The killer was when my daughter found a hair in her burger. I have not been back since.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Ate at 2 different Dee's. Great food; reasonable price; great service. decor reminds me of a 1960's diner, (retro). very nice.

data.title: Sole Survivor
data.text: This appears to be the last Dee's in the Salt Lake Valley. And no wonder. The food is mediocre and overpriced. Service is OK. But the menu is stuck in the '50s. I doubt I will ever eat there again. There's a Village Inn and Mad Greek across the street. Go there.

data.title: Great family place
data.text: Right outside Hampton Inn so being bushed from driving we walked across the parking lot for supper.  Skeptical at first we soon changed our minds.  Staff were great fun loving folks.  I had an open faced roast beef sandwich, wife had fish & chips.  Both were very good.  I sprang for a milkshake that was just the berries.  Supper was so good we went back the next day for breakfast before continuing our travels.
